events.originalText: Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh is shot and killed while reporting on an Israel Defense Forces raid on the Jenin Refugee Camp.
events.subtitle: Shireen Abu Akleh
events.headline: Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh shot and killed in Jenin Refugee Camp

events.originalText: Myanmar civil war: Government troops killed 37 unarmed civilians in Mondaingbin.
events.subtitle: Myanmar civil war (2021–present)
events.headline: Myanmar civil war: 37 unarmed civilians killed in Mondaingbin by Government troops

events.originalText: Two car bombs by unknown perpetrators exploded in Reyhanlı, Turkey, resulting in 52 killed and 140 injured.
events.subtitle: 2013 Reyhanlı car bombings
events.headline: 52 killed in Reyhanlı, Turkey car bomb explosions

events.originalText: An earthquake registering Mw 5.1, the worst to hit the region for more than 50 years, struck near Lorca, Spain.
events.subtitle: 2011 Lorca earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake hits Lorca, Spain with Mw 5.1 magnitude

events.originalText: David Cameron took office as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom as the Conservatives and Liberal Democrats formed the country's first coalition government since the Second World War.
events.subtitle: David Cameron
events.headline: David Cameron becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom in coalition government

events.originalText: Gordon Brown resigned as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Labour Party after failing to strike a coalition agreement with the Liberal Democrats.
events.subtitle: Gordon Brown
events.headline: Gordon Brown resigns as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

events.originalText: India began the Pokhran-II nuclear-weapons test, its first since the Smiling Buddha test 24 years earlier.
events.subtitle: Pokhran-II
events.headline: India conducts Pokhran-II nuclear-weapons test

events.originalText: Deep Blue (pictured) defeated Garry Kasparov in six games to become the first chess computer to win a match against a world champion.
events.subtitle: Deep Blue (chess computer)
events.headline: Deep Blue defeats Garry Kasparov in chess match

events.originalText: Andrew Lloyd Webber's Cats, the first megamusical, opened at the New London Theatre.
events.subtitle: Andrew Lloyd Webber
events.headline: Andrew Lloyd Webber's Cats opens at New London Theatre

events.originalText: Lubbock, Texas, was struck by a tornado that left 26 people dead.
events.subtitle: Lubbock, Texas
events.headline: Lubbock, Texas hit by tornado, 26 dead

events.originalText: African Americans rioted in Birmingham, Alabama, in response to two bombings, perceiving local police to be complicit with the perpetrators.
events.subtitle: Birmingham riot of 1963
events.headline: African Americans riot in Birmingham, Alabama after bombings

events.originalText: After a week-long standoff punctuated by military clashes, Japanese forces captured the city of Jinan, Shandong in China.
events.subtitle: Jinan incident
events.headline: Japanese forces capture Jinan, Shandong in China

events.originalText: Glacier National Park was established in the U.S. state of Montana.
events.subtitle: Glacier National Park (U.S.)
events.headline: Glacier National Park established in Montana

events.originalText: In response to a 28-percent wage cut, 4,000 Pullman Palace Car Company workers went on strike in Illinois, bringing rail traffic west of Chicago to a halt.
events.subtitle: Pullman Company
events.headline: Pullman Palace Car Company workers strike in Illinois

events.originalText: Bandits attacked a U.S. Army paymaster's escort in the Arizona Territory, stealing more than $28,000.
events.subtitle: Wham Paymaster robbery
events.headline: Bandits steal $28,000 from U.S. Army paymaster's escort in Arizona Territory

events.originalText: A land dispute between the Southern Pacific Railroad and settlers in Hanford, California, turned deadly when a gun battle broke out, leaving seven dead.
events.subtitle: Southern Pacific Transportation Company
events.headline: Deadly gun battle in Hanford, California over land dispute

events.originalText: Minnesota was carved out of the eastern half of the Minnesota Territory and admitted as the 32nd U.S. state.
events.subtitle: Minnesota
events.headline: Minnesota admitted as 32nd U.S. state

events.originalText: William Lawson, Gregory Blaxland and William Wentworth departed westward from Sydney on an expedition to become the first confirmed Europeans to cross the Blue Mountains (depicted).
events.subtitle: William Lawson (explorer)
events.headline: First Europeans cross Blue Mountains on expedition from Sydney

events.originalText: Spencer Perceval was shot in the lobby of the House of Commons, becoming the only British prime minister to be assassinated.
events.subtitle: Spencer Perceval
events.headline: British Prime Minister Spencer Perceval assassinated in House of Commons lobby

events.originalText: War of the Austrian Succession: French forces defeated those of the Pragmatic Allies at the Battle of Fontenoy in the Austrian Netherlands in present-day Belgium.
events.subtitle: War of the Austrian Succession
events.headline: French forces defeat Pragmatic Allies at Battle of Fontenoy in Belgian Netherlands

events.originalText: A copy of the Diamond Sutra was printed in Tang-dynasty China, making it the world's oldest dated printed book (frontispiece pictured).
events.subtitle: Diamond Sutra
